metadata.title: CVE-2020-25705 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw in ICMP packets in the Linux kernel may allow an attacker to quicklyscan open UDP ports. This flaw allows an off-path remote attacker toeffectively bypass source port UDP randomization. Software that relies onUDP source port randomization are indirectly affected as well on the LinuxBased Products (RUGGEDCOM RM1224: All versions between v5.0 and v6.4,SCALANCE M-800: All versions between v5.0 and v6.4, SCALANCE S615: Allversions between v5.0 and v6.4, SCALANCE SC-600: All versions prior tov2.1.3, SCALANCE W1750D: v8.3.0.1, v8.6.0, and v8.7.0, SIMATIC CloudConnect 7: All versions, SIMATIC MV500 Family: All versions, SIMATIC NET CP1243-1 (incl. SIPLUS variants): Versions 3.1.39 and later, SIMATIC NET CP1243-7 LTE EU: Version

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
